title: Filipe Anunciação
text:
Filipe Alexandre Dias Anunciação (born 27 May 1979) is a Portuguese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Manager%20%28association%20football%29">manager</a> and former professional player who played as a <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>. He is the current assistant manager of <a href="Belenenses%20SAD">Belenenses SAD</a>.
Club career.
Anunciação was born in <a href="Matosinhos">Matosinhos</a>. During his early career he played mostly in the <a href="Segunda%20Liga">Portuguese second division</a>, and represented <a href="C.D.%20Feirense">C.D. Feirense</a>, <a href="F.C.%20Pa%C3%A7os%20de%20Ferreira">F.C. Paços de Ferreira</a>, <a href="C.D.%20Aves">C.D. Aves</a>, <a href="Boavista%20F.C.">Boavista F.C.</a> and <a href="Moreirense%20F.C.">Moreirense FC</a>.
In 2007, Anunciação returned to Paços for a second spell, going on to spend several seasons in the <a href="Primeira%20Liga">Primeira Liga</a>, mainly as a starter. Towards the end of his career, in the <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20Primeira%20Liga">2012–13 campaign</a>, the 33-year-old still appeared in 17 games – four starts, 464 minutes of action – as the team finished a best-ever third and <a href="2013%E2%80%9314%20UEFA%20Champions%20League">qualified</a> to the <a href="UEFA%20Champions%20League">UEFA Champions League</a>; he was also the undisputed <a href="Captain%20%28association%20football%29">team captain</a> when available.
Anunciação retired in November 2014, being immediately appointed his main club's assistant coach. He amassed top flight totals of 244 matches and six goals, over the course of 13 seasons.
